014package org.jdbi.v3.core.mapper;
015
016import java.sql.ResultSet;
017import java.sql.ResultSetMetaData;
018import java.sql.SQLException;
019import java.util.ArrayList;
020import java.util.LinkedHashMap;
021import java.util.LinkedHashSet;
022import java.util.List;
023import java.util.Map;
024import java.util.Set;
025import java.util.function.Function;
026import java.util.function.UnaryOperator;
027
028import org.jdbi.v3.core.statement.StatementContext;
029
030/**
031 * Yo dawg, I heard you like maps, so I made you a mapper that maps rows into {@code Map<String,Object>}. Map
032 * keys are column names, while map values are the values in those columns. Map keys are converted to lowercase by
033 * default.
034 *
035 * @see GenericMapMapperFactory
036 */
037public class MapMapper implements RowMapper<Map<String, Object>> {
038    /**
039     * @deprecated remove
040     */
041    @Deprecated
042    private final Function<StatementContext, UnaryOperator<String>> caseStrategy;
043
044    /**
045     * Constructs a new MapMapper and delegates case control to MapMappers.
046     */
047    public MapMapper() {
048        caseStrategy = ctx -> ctx.getConfig(MapMappers.class).getCaseChange();
049    }
050
051    /**
052     * Constructs a new MapMapper
053     * @param toLowerCase if true, column names are converted to lowercase in the mapped {@link Map}. If false, nothing is done. Use the other constructor to delegate case control to MapMappers instead.
054     */
055    // TODO deprecate when MapMappers.caseChange is out of beta
056    public MapMapper(boolean toLowerCase) {
057        caseStrategy = toLowerCase ? ctx -> CaseStrategy.LOCALE_LOWER : ctx -> CaseStrategy.NOP;
058    }
059
060    @Override
061    public Map<String, Object> map(ResultSet rs, StatementContext ctx) throws SQLException {
062        return specialize(rs, ctx).map(rs, ctx);
063    }
064
065    @Override
066    public RowMapper<Map<String, Object>> specialize(ResultSet rs, StatementContext ctx) throws SQLException {
067        final List<String> columnNames = getColumnNames(rs, caseStrategy.apply(ctx));
068
069        return (r, c) -> {
070            Map<String, Object> row = new LinkedHashMap<>(columnNames.size());
071
072            for (int i = 0; i < columnNames.size(); i++) {
073                row.put(columnNames.get(i), rs.getObject(i + 1));
074            }
075
076            return row;
077        };
078    }
079
080    private static List<String> getColumnNames(ResultSet rs, UnaryOperator<String> caseChange) throws SQLException {
081        // important: ordered and unique
082        Set<String> columnNames = new LinkedHashSet<>();
083        ResultSetMetaData meta = rs.getMetaData();
084        int columnCount = meta.getColumnCount();
085
086        for (int i = 0; i < columnCount; i++) {
087            String columnName = meta.getColumnName(i + 1);
088            String alias = meta.getColumnLabel(i + 1);
089
090            String name = caseChange.apply(alias == null ? columnName : alias);
091
092            boolean added = columnNames.add(name);
093            if (!added) {
094                throw new RuntimeException("column " + name + " appeared twice in this resultset!");
095            }
096        }
097
098        return new ArrayList<>(columnNames);
099    }
100}
